bibl.title: Despatch from Francisco Joaquim Ferra do Amaral to United States Vice Consul
Despatches from United States Consuls in St Paul Loanda

div1.p: By what is affirmed by the missionaries, it appears that they were given notice to leave Bailundo in eight days and even then they stayed six weeks, and it seems only rational that during that time they should have sent one of their members to Benguella to obtain a letter from the Governor to the Sobba to assure him that in whatever intrigues my name or that Governor's might be involved, had no foundation whatever and was utterly false.

This the missionaries did not do and consequently they have only themselves to blame. What part the Portuguese merchant Braga weight have had in the matter that very much. I lament to have been the determination of the Sobba of Bailundo, I cannot tell you, as I await information from the Governor of Benguella who left for the interior with the intention of complaining of the affair and to
